entry.headline: Exxon says no effect from boiler shutdown - filing
entry.body:
NEW YORK, June 22 (Reuters) - Exxon Mobil Corp (XOM.N) said Monday a boiler shutdown at its 562,500 barrel-per-day refinery would not affect production, according to a filing with state regulators.

The boiler was being restarted after tripping offline, the filing with the Texas Commission for Environmental Quality said. The incident also resulted in flaring from the gasoline-making fluid catalytic cracking unit, according to the filing. (Reporting by Rebekah Kebede; Editing by John Picinich)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: CORRECTED - Goldman Sachs on pace for record bonuses - report
entry.body:
(Corrects name of newspaper)

* Strong first half sets pace - Observer

* Fewer competitors helping profit - report

* Insiders at firm briefed last week on progress

NEW YORK, June 22 (Reuters) - Goldman Sachs Group Inc (GS.N) is on pace to make record bonus payouts after a robust first half, London's Observer newspaper reported on Sunday.

Goldman staff in London were briefed on the outlook and told they could look forward to the bonus hikes if the company registers its most profitable year ever, the report said.

The surge in projected profit can be attributed to a lack of competition and increased revenue from trading foreign currency, bonds and fixed-income products, the newspaper said, citing insiders at the firm.

Bonuses have been a point of contention between the Obama administration and Wall Street, which last fall endured a credit crisis that paralyzed the financial markets. The U.S. Treasury responded with the Troubled Asset Relief Program, which made $700 billion in loans available to banks.

Goldman Sachs received $10 billion from TARP, which it repaid last week.

In letters to lawmakers last week, Goldman CEO Lloyd Blankfein said the firm is obligated to "ensure that compensation reflects the true performance of the firm and motivates proper behavior."

A Goldman Sachs spokesman in New York was not immediately available to comment on Monday. (Reporting by Steve Eder; editing by John Wallace)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Blavatnik to sue JPMorgan over investment losses: report
entry.body:
(Reuters) - U.S. billionaire Len Blavatnik is planning to file a lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase (JPM.N) on Monday, accusing the bank of mismanaging an investment account that held $1 billion in assets owned by Blavatnik's industrial holding company, Access Industries, the New York Times said.

In the proposed lawsuit, Blavatnik's lawyers blame Ted Ufferfilge, a JPMorgan banker advising Access, for losing $98 million of the company's money betting on risky subprime mortgage securities, according to the paper.

The proposed lawsuit contends that Ufferfilge told Access that its funds were being invested in conservative instruments, not securities that wound up at the center of the American mortgage crisis, the paper said, citing a draft of the complaint prepared by the law firm Quinn Emanuel Urquhart Oliver Hedges.

An Access spokesman told the paper that JPMorgan bought the subprime securities for Access "at a time when the bank itself was unwinding its positions in similar investments."

JPMorgan intends "to defend this matter vigorously," a spokeswoman for the bank told the paper. "We believe this lawsuit is meritless and a transparent attempt to recover losses resulting from the unprecedented market downturn," she told the paper.

The bank has hired the law firm Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton Garrison to represent it in the case, the paper added. JPMorgan and Access Industries could not be immediately reached for comment by Reuters.

(Reporting by Chakradhar Adusumilli in Bangalore; Editing by Muralikumar Anantharaman)

entry.author: Bill Rigby
entry.headline: Salesforce CEO jabs at Microsoft cloud moves
entry.body:
SEATTLE (Reuters) - Salesforce.com Inc's (CRM.N) outspoken chief executive took a few jabs at Microsoft Corp's (MSFT.O) lumbering efforts to build up its "cloud computing" services on Thursday, on a visit to the world's largest software company's home town.

Marc Benioff, a former Oracle Corp ORCL.O employee who founded Salesforce.com 10 years ago, rarely misses a chance to bash Microsoft as he spreads his gospel of cutting out software installed on users' computers and getting companies to use applications over the web.

"We are all about no software and they are all about software," Benioff said at a lunch in Seattle, when asked about Microsoft. "We are all about creating a whole new movement of cloud computing to move companies away from Microsoft's proprietary technology and monopolistic business practices."

Salesforce, with a "Ghostbusters"-style logo with the word "software" in a red, barred circle, is not an immediate threat to Microsoft. The San Francisco-based company had just over $1 billion in revenue last fiscal year, compared to Microsoft's $60 billion.

But the smaller company has crept onto Microsoft's radar as it attracts more companies to run business applications over the web, saving money on software, servers and IT administration.

In doing so, Salesforce has put itself at the forefront of the broad phenomenon known as cloud computing, or selling software as a service. Microsoft -- led by chief software architect Ray Ozzie -- is moving in the same direction, the company says, but little has actually changed in its product line-up.

"I'm a huge fan of Ray Ozzie, but I know how hard it is to operate within the culture of Microsoft," said Benioff. "That's why you really haven't seen them deliver any breaking technology in this area yet, even though they've been talking about it for many years."

Microsoft has been investing heavily in date storage centers and is expected to roll-out its "Azure" platform for cloud-based applications later this year. But Benioff was skeptical.

"I call it Azune, because it's got the same opportunities," Benioff joked, referring to Microsoft's relatively unpopular Zune digital music player.

Benioff did not offer any hopes for a quick recovery from the recession, but said his company was controlling costs and customers were adapting to conditions.

"Customers are starting to get their sea-legs, learning how to operate in this environment," he said.

(Reporting by Bill Rigby; Editing Bernard Orr)

FILED UNDER:

entry.headline: MannKind Closes Acquisition of Insulin Assets from Pfizer
entry.body: VALENCIA, Calif.--(Business Wire)-- MannKind Corporation (Nasdaq:MNKD) today announced that it has completed its acquisition from Pfizer Inc. (NYSE:PFE) of a quantity of bulk insulin and a license to manufacture bulk insulin for use in pulmonary delivery pursuant to an insulin sale and purchase agreement. Upon the closing, MannKind and Pfizer also entered into an agreement pursuant to which MannKind agreed to maintain and store the remainder of Pfizer`s bulk insulin inventory and acquired an option to purchase the remaining insulin, in whole or in part, at a specified price, to the extent that Pfizer has not otherwise disposed of or used the remaining insulin. The total purchase price for this transaction, including consideration payable to MannKind for its storage and maintenance obligations, was $3 million, which MannKind paid in cash. MannKind had also entered into a sale and purchase agreement with Pfizer relating to Pfizer`s insulin manufacturing facility in Frankfurt, Germany. MannKind`s rights and obligations under this latter agreement were subject to a right of first refusal in favor of Sanofi-Aventis. On June 8, 2009, Sanofi-Aventis exercised its right of first refusal, thereby releasing MannKind from any obligations under this agreement. About AFRESA AFRESA is an ultra rapid acting insulin product that has completed Phase 3 trials. The pharmacokinetic profile of AFRESA sets it apart from all other insulin products. The large surface area of the lung provides unique access to the circulatory system. The pH-sensitive AFRESA particles immediately dissolve upon contact with the lung surface, releasing insulin monomers that rapidly enter the bloodstream. It achieves peak insulin levels within 12-14 minutes of administration, effectively mimicking the release of meal-time insulin observed in healthy individuals, but which is absent from patients with diabetes. About MannKind Corporation MannKind Corporation (Nasdaq:MNKD) focuses on the discovery, development and commercialization of therapeutic products for patients with diseases such as diabetes and cancer. Its diabetes pipeline includes AFRESA, which has completed phase 3 clinical trials, and MKC253, which is currently in phase 1 clinical trials. MannKind has submitted an NDA to the FDA requesting approval of AFRESA for the treatment of adults with type 1 or type 2 diabetes for the control of hyperglycemia. MannKind maintains a website at http://www.mannkindcorp.com to which MannKind regularly posts copies of its press releases as well as additional information about MannKind. Interested persons can subscribe on the MannKind website to e-mail alerts that are sent automatically when MannKind issues press releases, files its reports with the Securities and Exchange Commission or posts certain other information to the website. MannKind Corporation Matthew J. Pfeffer, 661-775-5300 Corporate Vice President and Chief Financial Officer mpfeffer@mannkindcorp.com Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.headline: MetaVis Technologies Announces MetaVis ARCHITECT and CLASSIFIER for Microsoft SharePoint
entry.body: PHILADELPHIA, PA, Jun 22 (MARKET WIRE) -- MetaVis Technologies, Inc. today announced the general availability of MetaVis ARCHITECT and MetaVis CLASSIFIER, software that extends the value of Microsoft SharePoint by enhancing document search, findability and eDiscovery. MetaVis products provide taxonomy support and metadata management to SharePoint making it easier for information architects to create, deploy and manage SharePoint sites. A trial version of the products can be downloaded at www.metavistech.com. MetaVis will also be demonstrating both products at the SharePoint Technology Conference in Boston, June 22-24 at the Hyatt Regency Cambridge. Metadata management and efficient taxonomies enable enterprise content to be easily found after it is categorized and tagged. Designing and deploying SharePoint sites with structured metadata models is time intensive and can require highly specialized professionals. More importantly, once created these models cannot be reused -- meaning that companies need to recreate them for each SharePoint site. MetaVis believes that taxonomy management should not be complicated or require additional IT support to implement and use. Both MetaVis ARCHITECT and CLASSIFIER are based on an intuitive, graphical interface that is easy to use and easy to install. "SharePoint's organic growth within company departments and business groups have presented many IT challenges related to document consistency, search and eDiscovery," said Steven Pogrebivsky, CEO and Co-founder of MetaVis Technologies. "As a result, companies can be at greater risk of not meeting corporate compliance or governance guidelines. We developed MetaVis ARCHITECT and CLASSIFIER to help information architects, administrators, and consultants simplify the management of SharePoint content as well as improve document search and compliance. Our tools save users valuable time and resources while providing a central management tool to deploy and maintain SharePoint content." MetaVis ARCHITECT MetaVis ARCHITECT for SharePoint allows information architects to develop and maintain efficient SharePoint taxonomies. ARCHITECT visualizes a SharePoint environment through two-dimensional graphical diagrams allowing users to edit diagram elements and provision or synchronize updates to SharePoint. As an architect or a business user, the ability to graphically visualize the metadata environment provides the system-wide awareness necessary to design taxonomies that improve search and eDiscovery. MetaVis diagrams not only expose metadata structures but also their relationships, making SharePoint sites easily understood and well documented. With MetaVis ARCHITECT users can: -- Design and redesign taxonomy structures for a new SharePoint site or resuse taxonomy from other sites; -- Replicate or consolidate columns, content types and lists; -- Optimize search by enforcing standard content structure; and -- Compare metadata models across different sites for consistency. MetaVis CLASSIFIER MetaVis CLASSIFIER helps to organize and enhance SharePoint content and its metadata. CLASSIFIER capabilities include importing and tagging content with new values and content types; moving or coping content to different folders, lists sites or servers; or doing all simultaneously. By tagging files that share common metadata values, CLASSIFIER improves metadata management making content more findable, compliant and usable. With MetaVis CLASSIFIER users can: -- Tag and move previously loaded documents, en masse, with regulatory data, retention dates and useful keywords; -- Import or migrate bulk content from both SharePoint and file systems; and -- Classify multiple types of content at once with new metadata values. About MetaVis Technologies, Inc. MetaVis Technologies is a provider of software that extends the value of Microsoft SharePoint by enhancing search, findability and eDiscovery. MetaVis products allow information architects and administrators to develop and maintain reusable taxonomies and better organize SharePoint content. The company believes that taxonomy management should not be complicated or require highly specialized professionals to implement and use. MetaVis products are based on intuitive, graphical interfaces that are easy to use and easy to install. For more information and to download a free trial of the MetaVis Architect Suite, visit www.metavistech.com. Media Contact: Alicia Libucha MetaVis Technologies 857-205-0919 Email Contact Copyright 2009, Market Wire, All rights reserved. -0-

entry.headline: Confio Software Achieves Microsoft Certification for SQL Server 2008
entry.body: BOULDER, CO, Jun 22 (MARKET WIRE) -- Confio Software, the leader in Response Time database performance management tools, today announced that Confio Ignite(R) for SQL Server has passed Microsoft certification testing for SQL Server 2008. Ignite for SQL Server is part of the Confio Igniter Suite(R) PI for monitoring, managing and optimizing databases and the applications that depend on them. This certification recognizes Confio Software's expertise on the latest version of SQL Server, and reflects Confio's investment in SQL Server performance, its fastest growing product line. "Confio's mission is to improve database performance and the rapid growth of SQL Server 2008 for business critical applications makes it the perfect platform for our Ignite performance management solution," said Confio's COO Don Bergal. "We see tremendous growth in Microsoft SQL Server adoption for performance critical applications." "Only companies that have demonstrated high levels of customer service, proved their experience and attained advanced certification receive the designation of Microsoft Certified Partner," said Allison Watson, corporate vice president of Worldwide Partner Group at Microsoft Corp. "Today, Microsoft recognizes Confio Software for its skills and expertise in providing customer satisfaction with Microsoft products and technology." Built on twin foundations of Performance Intelligence and Response Time measurement, Confio develops the Igniter(TM) Suite for Oracle, SQL Server, Sybase and DB2. For DBAs, developers and IT managers, Ignite identifies and resolves the bottlenecks that cause business applications to wait on the database. Confio Ignite for SQL Server identifies the bottlenecks and locks that cause applications to wait on SQL Server, and helps DBAs and developers quickly resolve those problems most impacting the end users. Ignite installs in minutes without placing any software on the monitored SQL Server. Confio customers have saved thousands to millions of dollars by avoiding costly hardware upgrades, and improved service levels for application users. Free trials are available for download at www.confio.com/freetrial. About Confio Software Confio Software develops Oracle, SQL Server, DB2, & Sybase database performance management solutions that are revolutionizing how databases and the applications that depend on them are monitored, managed and optimized. Built on industry best-practice Wait-Time methods, Confio Igniter Suite improves service levels and reduces costs for database and application infrastructure. Confio is based in Boulder, Colorado, with customers worldwide. For more information see www.confio.com. Confio and Confio Ignite are trademarks or registered trademarks of Confio Software Corporation, in the United States and/or in other countries. Other product and company names herein may be trademarks of their respective owners. Media Contact Jay Bright Global Alliances & Marketing Manager Tel: +1.303.385.2324 Email Contact www.confio.com Copyright 2009, Market Wire, All rights reserved. -0-

entry.headline: IBM launches Wimbledon smartphone application
entry.body:
LONDON (Reuters) - Tennis fans at Wimbledon will be able to keep up with the action using a smartphone application developed by IBM, which it said could transform the way spectators access information at sporting events.

The application, which runs on Google's Android operating system, superimposes real-time statistics and updates from social networking site Twitter, including comments from players, onto a video feed from a handset's camera.

"It's about visualizing data in a different way," said Alan Flack, IBM's Client Executive for the All England Lawn Tennis Club (AELTC), in an interview.

"The trial needs to be fun to improve the experience people have at the tournament.

"By exploring new technologies, we can bring information to life by making it useful, engaging and accessible."

Rob McCowen, marketing director at the AELTC, said the application could change the way people engage with sporting events.

"These smart applications were designed with tennis fans in mind and add a whole new dimension to the event," he said in a statement.

The service, called Seer Android, is being trialed on T-Mobile's G1 mobile phone at the tournament, which started on Monday.

Pointing a G1 phone at a court, for example, would tell the user the court number, details of the current and previous matches and Twitter comments from experts and players, such as Andy Murray and Roger Federer.

IBM, which has been Wimbledon's IT partner since 1990, has also developed a Twitter aggregator, which combines all Wimbledon-based content into one channel, and a data application for Apple's iPhone for the tournament.

(Reporting by Paul Sandle; editing by Simon Jessop)

entry.headline: UPDATE 1-ChemChina taps JPMorgan for Dow unit bid -sources
entry.body:
* Dow AgroSciences unit booked $4.5 billion in sales in 2008

* Stage of bidding process still unclear

(Adds detail, background)

By Joseph Chaney

HONG KONG, June 22 (Reuters) - China National Chemical Corp (ChemChina), China's leading chemical producer, has retained JPMorgan to advise it on a bid for Dow Chemical's (DOW.N) agrosciences unit, sources said on Monday.

Dow AgroSciences -- which sells crop protection chemicals such as herbicides and insecticides -- booked 2008 sales of $4.5 billion, according to the company's website. The unit could be sold for as much as $7 billion, analysts said.

Dow Chemical, the largest U.S. chemicals maker, is selling assets to to help pay a $9.2 billion bridge loan talen out to buy chemical company Rohm Haas Corp in April. [ID:nN01305800]

Like other chemicals makers, Dow has been suffering from the economic recession and has already sold Rohm's Morton Salt unit for $1.7 billion and is evaluating options for other businesses in its portfolio.

It is unclear if the bidding process for the agrosciences unit is at a preliminary or advanced stage.

In March, Dow Chemical chief executive Andrew Liveris told Reuters the company would not be forced into selling assets on the cheap. "We've designed a structure where we can control our own destiny, rather than be forced to fire-sale," Liveris said at the time.

"More critically, we can retain very key assets like Dow AgroSciences and Dow Corning," said Liveris, adding Dow would consider selling a stake in Dow AgroSciences business if there were strategic benefits from the deal.

JPMorgan declined to comment. ChemChina was not immediately available for comment.

The sources declined to be named because they were not authorised to speak publicly about the matter.

In late February, media reports said private equity giants Blackstone (BX.N) and Kohlberg Kravis Roberts Co [KKR.UL] were in early-stage discussions about taking a multibillion-dollar minority stake in the division. (Reporting by Joseph Chaney; Editing by Dan Lalor)

FILED UNDER:

"By exploring new technologies, we can bring information to life by making it useful, engaging and accessible."

Rob McCowen, marketing director at the AELTC, said the application could change the way people engage with sporting events.

"These smart applications were designed with tennis fans in mind and add a whole new dimension to the event," he said in a statement.

The service, called Seer Android, is being trialled on T-Mobile's G1 mobile phone at the tournament, which started on Monday.

Pointing a G1 phone at a court, for example, would tell the user the court number, details of the current and previous matches and Twitter comments from experts and players, such as Andy Murray and Roger Federer.

IBM, which has been Wimbledon's IT partner since 1990, has also developed a Twitter aggregator, which combines all Wimbledon-based content into one channel, and a data application for Apple's (AAPL.O) iPhone for the tournament.

(Reporting by Paul Sandle; editing by Simon Jessop)

entry.headline: ExxonMobil Chemical Demonstrates Technology Leadership at International Rubber Conference 2009
entry.body: HOUSTON--(Business Wire)-- ExxonMobil Chemical will demonstrate its technology leadership and commitment to the global rubber industry at its booth (number 12-112) at the International Rubber Conference (IRC) 2009 in Nürnberg, Germany from June 29-July 2, 2009. Its broad portfolio of polymer solutions, including butyl polymers, specialty elastomers and polymer modifiers (PM) will be highlighted. At the forefront of innovation in the rubber industry since it invented and patented butyl rubber in 1937, ExxonMobil Chemical will demonstrate its continuous drive for product and process improvement to meet the evolving needs of the industry. With the objective of doubling the number of tire innerliner applications that can be served from existing halobutyl capacity, ExxonMobil Chemical recently conducted a successful pilot plant demonstration of next-generation butyl rubber that benefits from nanocomposite technology. The company also is working with its customers to develop a new material for tire innerliners, Exxcore DVA resin, which will result in lighter and more durable tires, that hold air longer and help reduce fuel consumption and carbon dioxide emissions. A technology leader in specialty elastomers, ExxonMobil Chemical is expanding the performance capabilities of its portfolio with innovative metallocene-based polymers to meet the latest requirements of the rubber and elastomer industry. These include new amorphous grades of Vistalon EPDM targeted at the extruded weatherseals market and Vistamaxx specialty elastomers providing green strength to rubber compounds. Santoprene TPVs are meeting the increased demand for recyclable, light weight sealing solutions, and EPDM bondable Santoprene TPV is enabling hard-soft material combinations for cost-effective system solutions. The recently introduced Santoprene TPV 8211-85 M350 is providing a unique "comfort touch" and excellent surface qualities for automotive interiors while offering significant cost reduction opportunities. Additionally, ExxonMobil Chemical has developed jointly with Troester GmbH & Co. a new extrusion concept, combining hard and soft thermoplastic materials that enables the replacement of the metal reinforcement in EPDM profiles with a thermoplastic alternative. This provides opportunities to lower part weight, while reducing production complexity compared with conventional EPDM sealing solutions. ExxonMobil Chemical will feature its wide range of Elevast polymer modifiers (PM) to the European rubber industry at IRC. Elevast PM are specialty hydrocarbon fluids that can help formulators create innovative solutions for polyolefin elastomer technical applications requiring improved mechanical properties across an extended range of service temperatures. Elevast PM improve polymer performance in applications ranging from wire and cable to automotive and industrial belts, weatherstrip, hoses and mechanical goods such as seals, gaskets and wiper blades. ExxonMobil Chemical will present three technical papers at the conference. "Polymers for innerliner applications - new trends or new developments" describes the latest developments to lower the rolling resistance of passenger car tires, reduce weight and improve performance. "New metallocene EPDM`s for expanded attribute range to meet new rubber market requirements" details recent advances in metallocene solution polymerization and compares expected physical properties with the properties provided by conventional Ziegler Natta polymerization. "Elevast polymer modifiers (PM) - highly efficient plasticizers for property enhancement of elastomers" looks at how Elevast PM can support EPDM rubber innovation. All presentations will take place on Tuesday, June 30th at the following times: 3.30-3.45pm: "New metallocene EPDM`s for expanded attribute range to meet new rubber market requirements" 3.45-4.00pm: "Elevast polymer modifiers (PM) - highly efficient plasticizers for property enhancement of elastomers" 4.00-4.30pm: "Polymers for innerliner applications - new trends or new developments" About ExxonMobil Chemical ExxonMobil Chemical is one of the world`s premier petrochemical companies with manufacturing, technology, and marketing operations around the world. The company delivers a broad portfolio of products and solutions efficiently and responsibly, with a commitment to create outstanding customer and shareholder value. ExxonMobil Chemical endorses the principles of sustainable development, including the need to balance economic growth, social development and environmental considerations. To learn more, visit www.exxonmobilchemical.com, www.butylrubber.com or www.elevast.com Note to Editors: 1. The terms, "we," "our," "ExxonMobil Chemical," or "ExxonMobil" are used for convenience, and may include any one or more of ExxonMobil Chemical Company, Exxon Mobil Corporation, or any affiliates they directly or indirectly steward. 2. ExxonMobil, the ExxonMobil Logo, the Interlocking "X" Device, Exxcore, Vistalon, Vistamaxx. Elevast and Santoprene are trademarks of ExxonMobil. ExxonMobil Chemical Media Contact: Jeff Neu, +1-281-870-6607 Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.author: None
entry.headline: ChemChina taps JPMorgan for Dow unit bid -sources
entry.body:
HONG KONG, June 22 (Reuters) - China National Chemical Corp (ChemChina), the mainland's top chemical producer, has retained JPMorgan (JPM.N) to advise it on a bid for Dow Chemical's (DOW.N) agrosciences unit, sources said on Monday.

Dow's agrosciences unit booked full-year sales of $4.5 billion in 2008 according to the company's website.

Dow, the largest U.S. chemicals maker, is shedding a host of assets to raise cash to pay off a $9.2 billion bridge loan it took on when it purchased chemical company Rohm Haas Corp in April.

JPMorgan declined to comment. ChemChina was not immediately available for comment. (Reporting by Joseph Chaney; Editing by Chris Lewis)

entry.author: None
entry.headline: UPDATE 2-ExxonMobil says near deal on potential LNG sales
entry.body:
* Exxon says near sales deal with 3 major LNG buyers in Asia

* Potential sales to Asian buyers are for a total 4.3 mtpa

* PNG LNG project on track to fully contract proposed output

* Japan's TEPCO in discussions to buy long-term LNG - report (Adds TEPCO in 5th para)

By Fayen Wong

PERTH, June 22 (Reuters) - ExxonMobil (XOM.N), operator of a liquefied natural gas project in Papua New Guinea, is nearing agreement on sales with three major buyers in Asia, putting the project on track for a final investment decision later this year.

The sale of 4.3 million tonnes per annum (mtpa), plus an earlier 2 mtpa deal, would mean the project was fully contracted for its proposed total output, cementing its frontrunner status among a dozen competing LNG hopefuls in the region.

ExxonMobil said on Monday its subsidiary Esso Highland Ltd, has "reached alignment on commercial terms" with three major LNG customers in Asia for long-term LNG sales.

"Exclusive discussions will commence with these customers to finalise binding sales and purchase agreements to establish the project's foundation customers," Exxon said in a statement.

Japan's Nikkei business daily reported that Asia's biggest utility, Tokyo Electric Power Co (TEPCO) (9501.T), would buy close to 2 mtpa of LNG from the project. TEPCO acknowledged it was in talks, but declined to comment on the details.

In a sales agreement announced in April for 2 mtpa, the customer is awaiting approval from its government on the key commercial terms, Exxon said.

For a factbox on a list of proposed LNG projects in the Asia-Pacific region, click on [ID:nSYD475128]

Energy firms have said that, despite the recent global financial crisis, interest among Asian buyers to secure long-term LNG supplies has remained firm.

Exxon holds a 41.5 percent stake in the PNG project, while Australian-listed Oil Search Ltd (OSH.AX) has 34 percent and Santos Ltd (STO.AX) owns 17.7 percent. Nippon Oil 5001.T and PNG landowners own the rest.

Shares in Oil Search were up 2.2 percent to A$5.64 in early trade, while Santos shares rose 0.1 percent to A$14.90 in a broader market up 0.6 percent .AXJO.

The project, also known as PNG LNG, is estimated to cost between $10-$11 billion and is targeting first LNG delivery in late 2013 or early 2014. (Additional reporting by Osamu Tsukimori in Tokyo; Editing by Michael Urquhart)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Blavatnik to sue JPMorgan over investment losses- NYT
entry.body:
June 22 (Reuters) - U.S. billionaire Len Blavatnik is planning to file a lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase (JPM.N) on Monday, accusing the bank of mismanaging an investment account that held $1 billion in assets owned by Blavatnik's industrial holding company, Access Industries, the New York Times said.

In the proposed lawsuit, Blavatnik's lawyers blame Ted Ufferfilge, a JPMorgan banker advising Access, for losing $98 million of the company's money betting on risky subprime mortgage securities, according to the paper.

The proposed lawsuit contends that Ufferfilge told Access that its funds were being invested in conservative instruments, not securities that wound up at the center of the American mortgage crisis, the paper said, citing a draft of the complaint prepared by the law firm Quinn Emanuel Urquhart Oliver Hedges.

An Access spokesman told the paper that JPMorgan bought the subprime securities for Access "at a time when the bank itself was unwinding its positions in similar investments."

JPMorgan intends "to defend this matter vigorously", a spokeswoman for the bank told the paper. "We believe this lawsuit is meritless and a transparent attempt to recover losses resulting from the unprecedented market downturn," she told the paper.

The bank has hired the law firm Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton Garrison to represent it in the case, the paper added. JPMorgan and Access Industries could not be immediately reached for comment by Reuters. (Reporting by Chakradhar Adusumilli in Bangalore; Editing by Muralikumar Anantharaman)

entry.headline: Ex-Goldman partner raises $2.5 bln fund - sources
entry.body:
HONG KONG, June 24 (Reuters) - Mount Kellett Capital Management, a private equity firm run by former Goldman Sachs (GS.N) partner Mark McGoldrick, has completed raising around $2.5 billion for its first fund with focus on Asia, especially China, said sources close to the matter.

The Asia-focused firm, which McGoldrick launched early last year, had initially targetted to raise about $5 billion. McGoldrick is nicknamed 'Goldfinger' for his surname and his reportedly massive bonus payout.

For related Asian private equity news, Reuters 3000 Xtra users can double click on: [LEN-RTRS-ASIA-PVE] (Reporting by George Chen, Editing by Jacqueline Wong)

entry.author: None
entry.headline: IBM names new M&A chief after losing chief to Dell
entry.body:
* IBM taps former Morgan Stanley banker as head of mergers

* IBM waits on suit to bar ex-exec from working at Dell

BOSTON, June 23 (Reuters) - IBM (IBM.N) named one of its executives, a former Morgan Stanley (MS.N) banker, to be its new head of mergers and acquisitions on Tuesday after losing its chief dealmaker to rival Dell Inc DELL.O, which is beefing up its acquisition efforts.

IBM named Elias Mendoza, who handled mergers and acquisitions in Asia for the computer consulting and technology company, to the top MA job as it waits for a U.S. federal court to rule on a request that the man he replaces be banned from working for Dell.

Before joining IBM in 2006, Mendoza worked for investment bank Morgan Stanley.

IBM claims that his predecessor, David Johnson, violated a 2005 non-compete agreement by taking the Dell post in May.

"Mr. Johnson has possession of valuable confidential information of IBM and cannot undertake a senior strategy position at Dell without violating his obligations to IBM," the company said in a statement as it filed its lawsuit last month.

A judge in the U.S. District Court of Southern New York could rule on IBM's request as early as this week.

An IBM spokesman declined to comment on the litigation on Tuesday.

The litigation comes as IBM seeks to rebound after a rare public embarrassment over its MA efforts, a failed attempt to buy hardware maker Sun Microsystems Inc JAVA.O.

It emerged as the lead contender in March to buy the company but discussions collapsed in April mainly because both sides were unable to agree on guarantees for IBM to be able to walk away should the deal fail to pass regulatory scrutiny.

Software developer Oracle ORCL.O swooped in with a successful bid to buy Sun for more than $7 billion. [ID:nN20381533] (Reporting by Jim Finkle; Editing by Gary Hill)

entry.headline: Keller Rohrback Announces Preliminary Approval of Settlement in Arizona Microsoft...
entry.body: Keller Rohrback Announces Preliminary Approval of Settlement in Arizona Microsoft Operating Systems and Applications Litigation SEATTLE, June 23, 2009 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Seattle law firm Keller Rohrback, L.L.P., and its Phoenix, AZ affiliate, Keller Rohrback P.L.C. (www.krclassaction.com), announced today that Judge J. Frederick Motz of the U.S. District Court for the District of Maryland has preliminarily approved a settlement in the pending class action litigation brought by Daisy Mountain Fire District ("Plaintiff") on behalf of a class of all Arizona state and local governmental entities that purchased Microsoft operating systems and applications software between May 18, 1994 and December 31, 2008 (the "Class"). The preliminarily approved settlement will result in the payment of $4,415,258 by Microsoft Corp. ("Microsoft") (Nasdaq:MSFT) to the Class. The settlement funds will be allocated across Arizona state and local governmental entities. The litigation centered on allegations that Microsoft illegally obtained and maintained monopoly power in the market for operating systems and certain business productivity applications and used that power to charge higher prices for its MS/DOS and Windows operating systems and for several popular applications like Word, MS Office, and Excel. The Plaintiff alleged that Microsoft engaged in conduct that violated Arizona's state antitrust statutes and caused damage to all Arizona governmental entities that had bought such equipment after May 18, 1994 until December 31, 2008. Microsoft denied these allegations. The preliminarily approved settlement gives each Arizona governmental entity its share of the settlement, in cash, to be used for the purchase of various computer equipment, not just Microsoft products. Because the litigation is a class action, the settlement is subject the Court's final approval after notice of the terms of the settlement has been provided to class members. Timing of the approval process is dependent on the Court's schedule. Notice will be provided to all involved Arizona governmental entities and they will have a period during which they can comment or object to any aspect of the preliminarily approved settlement, after which Judge Motz, who has overseen the private, state and federal litigation, concerning Microsoft's monopoly power, will decide whether the settlement is in the best interests of class members. For questions or additional information, please contact attorneys Mark Griffin or Mark Samson at (800) 776-6044. -0- CONTACT: Keller Rohrback L.L.P. Press Contacts: Mark Griffin, Attorney Mark Samson, Attorney 800-776-6044

entry.author: None
entry.headline: JPMorgan tops strong bank list, RBS biggest loss
entry.body:
LONDON (Reuters) - JPMorgan tops a list of the world's strongest banks, while Royal Bank of Scotland suffered the biggest loss of any lender last year, according to new industry rankings on Wednesday.

RBS's $59.3 billion loss last year eclipsed all rivals, including Citigroup's $53 billion loss and Wells Fargo's $47.8 billion loss, according to The Banker magazine.

Global bank profits slumped 85 percent last year to $115 billion, down from $781 billion, and return on equity plunged to 2.69 percent from 20 percent, the magazine estimated.

JPMorgan topped The Banker's annual list of the strongest 1,000 global banks, moving up from fourth place a year earlier. The rankings, which have run since the 1970s, are based on capital strength, or the amount of Tier 1 capital held.

Bank of America ranked second, Citigroup was third and RBS was fourth, despite the problems for all three last year. JPMorgan was helped by its takeover of Bear Stearns and Washington Mutual and Bank of America was boosted by its acquisition of Merrill Lynch.

HSBC fell to fifth spot from first, but it was the only one of the top five not to receive any government support, and would rank third if government support was stripped out, The Banker said. Mitsubishi UFJ was the highest ranked Asian bank in seventh, a place ahead of China's ICBC.

ICBC was the most profitable bank last year with earnings of $21.3 billion, the Banker estimated.

The five most profitable banks were all from China or Spain. China Construction Bank ranked second with a $17.5 billion profit, followed by Santander ($15.8 billion), Bank of China ($12.6 billion) and BBVA (9.6 billion).

They were followed by Britain's HSBC ($9.3 billion) and Barclays ($8.9 billion).

(Reporting by Steve Slater; editing by Elaine Hardcastle)

entry.headline: JPMorgan tops strong bank list, RBS biggest loss
entry.body:
LONDON, June 24 (Reuters) - JPMorgan (JPM.N) tops a list of the world's strongest banks, while Royal Bank of Scotland (RBS.L) suffered the biggest loss of any lender last year, according to new industry rankings on Wednesday. RBS's $59.3 billion loss last year eclipsed all rivals, including Citigroup's (C.N) $53 billion loss and Wells Fargo's (WFC.N) $47.8 billion loss, according to The Banker magazine.

Global bank profits slumped 85 percent last year to $115 billion, down from $781 billion, and return on equity plunged to 2.69 percent from 20 percent, the magazine estimated.

JPMorgan topped The Banker's annual list of the strongest 1,000 global banks, moving up from fourth place a year earlier. The rankings, which have run since the 1970s, are based on capital strength, or the amount of Tier 1 capital held.

Bank of America (BAC.N) ranked second, Citigroup (C.N) was third and RBS was fourth, despite the problems for all three last year. JPMorgan was helped by its takeover of Bear Stearns and Washington Mutual and Bank of America was boosted by its acquisition of Merrill Lynch.

HSBC (HSBA.L) fell to fifth spot from first, but it was the only one of the top five not to receive any government support, and would rank third if government support was stripped out, The Banker said. Mitsubishi UFJ (8306.T) was the highest ranked Asian bank in seventh, a place ahead of China's ICBC (1398.HK).

ICBC was the most profitable bank last year with earnings of $21.3 billion, the Banker estimated.

The five most profitable banks were all from China or Spain. China Construction Bank (0939.HK) ranked second with a $17.5 billion profit, followed by Santander (SAN.MC) ($15.8 billion), Bank of China (3988.HK) ($12.6 billion) and BBVA (BBVA.MC) (9.6 billion).

They were followed by Britain's HSBC ($9.3 billion) and Barclays (BARC.L) ($8.9 billion).

(Reporting by Steve Slater; editing by Elaine Hardcastle)

entry.headline: Texas in highway partnership with JPMorgan, Cintra
entry.body:
NEW YORK, June 23 (Reuters) - The Texas Department of Transportation on Tuesday launched a public-private partnership with a consortium that includes JPMorgan Chase and Spain's Cintra to build and operate 13 miles of highway in Tarrant County.

The state will invest about $570 million in a project valued at about $2.5 billion, the Transportation Department said in a statement.

The consortium, North Tarrant Express, Mobility Partners consists of 11 equity sponsors, including JPMorgan Chase Co (JPM.N), Cintra CCIT.MC and engineering companies. The Dallas police and fire pension system also has the option of investing in the project.

Tarrant County is located in north-central Texas. (Reporting by Tom Ryan; Editing by Leslie Adler)

entry.author: None
entry.headline: UPDATE 3-Chevron begins production at Frade field in Brazil
entry.body:
* Expects peak output of 90,000 barrels per day in 2011

* Crude to be exported, natural gas for use in Brazil

* Adds to bullish view of Chevron production outlook (Adds details on Frade, Tombua Landana and Piceance Basin, bylines, SAN FRANCISCO to dateline)

By Brian Ellsworth and Braden Reddall

RIO DE JANEIRO/SAN FRANCISCO, June 23 (Reuters) - Chevron Corp (CVX.N) announced on Tuesday a slightly earlier start of oil output at the Frade field, a $3 billion project off Brazil's coast expected to produce 90,000 barrels per day by 2011.

Crude oil from Frade, located some 230 miles (370 km) from Rio de Janeiro in 3,700 feet (1,128 meters) of water, will be shipped to other markets, while the natural gas is slated for use in Brazil.

Frade's start-up, which had been due in the second half of 2009, will only add to a bullish view of Chevron's production outlook.

The company reported first-quarter output of 2.66 million barrels per day, versus its overall 2009 estimate of 2.63 million bpd, and it has since announced first oil at its Tahiti field in the Gulf of Mexico.

"Look for a 2009 volume-target raise," Deutsche Bank analyst Paul Sankey wrote in a research note on Tuesday, after meeting with Chevron's management. Sankey has a "hold" rating on the stock due to the bank's bearish view of oil prices.

Shares of Chevron rose 0.3 percent to $65.96, helped by a 2 percent rise in oil prices CLc1.

Chevron said it expects about 30,000 bpd from Frade in its initial phase in 2009. Overall, it estimates there are 200 million to 300 million barrels of recoverable oil there.

The San Ramon, California-based company holds a 52 percent operating interest, while state-run Petrobras (PETR4.SA) and Japanese partners INPEX, Sojitz and JOGMEC hold the rest.

The project will help Chevron expand in "one of the world's most promising deepwater oil and gas regions," George Kirkland, Chevron's executive vice president for upstream and gas, said in a statement.

Frade is not part of Brazil's sub-salt reserves, which aremassive oil fields found deep beneath a layer of salt that have drawn investor interest and that analysts say could turn the South American nation into a major oil exporter.

MORE PROJECTS IN PIPELINE

Chevron anticipates a base business decline of 180,000 bpd this year, and has recently had to shut in 100,000 bpd of production in Nigeria's Delta state due to violence.

But it will see more production from its deepwater Agbami project off Nigeria, which was up to 170,000 bpd in March from 100,000 bpd late last year.

Also in western Africa, production is set to start this year at the Tombua Landana project in Angola, in which operator Chevron holds 31 percent and Total (TOTF.PA), ENI (ENI.MI) and state operator Sonangol each hold 20 percent.

Closer to home, Chevron said on Tuesday it still expects to start natural gas production in Colorado's Piceance Basin this year, despite a slowdown in drilling there due to weak prices.

On Monday, larger rival Exxon Mobil Corp (XOM.N) unveiled new field processing capacity for Piceance natural gas. (Reporting by Brian Ellsworth in Rio de Janeiro and Braden Reddall in San Francisco; Editing by Walter Bagley)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Disney Interactive Studios and Black Rock Studio Repeat as Best Racing Game Winner for Split/Second -- Game Critics Awards: Best of E3 2009
entry.body: Black Rock Studio Becomes First Developer to Win Racing Award Consecutive Years with Different Original Properties BURBANK, Calif.--(Business Wire)-- Split/Second, the action racing game fromDisney Interactive Studios and Black Rock Studio, was selected this morning as Best Racing Game in the Game Critics Awards: Best of E3 2009. The award gives Black Rock Studio back-to-back victories in the category and marks the first time a development studio repeated in the racing category with different original properties. "The award is tremendous recognition for the innovation and uniqueness of Split/Second, which distinguished it from other established racing franchises and new properties," said Tony Beckwith, vice president and general manager, Black Rock Studio. "Being the first development studio to win this award consecutively with two different racing game properties recognizes the accomplishments of both of our development teams." Set within the world of a hyper-competitive reality television show in a made-for-TV city rigged for destruction, Split/Second is an intense action racing game in which competitors can trigger events that take out opponents or completely change the track as they compete for the ultimate prize - to become the season`s champion. Split/Second will be released in early 2010 for the Xbox 360 video game and entertainment system from Microsoft, PLAYSTATION3 computer entertainment system and Windows PC. Split/Second is currently available for pre-order at select major retail chains. Split/Second was also selected for X-Play`s Best Racing Game of E3 2009 from G4 and was nominated for numerous other E3 awards. The Game Critics Awards are chosen by a consortium of video games media representing 29 industry and consumer publications. The annual awards recognize the most outstanding products shown at the annual Electronic Entertainment Expo (E3) which was held June 2-4, 2009. Black Rock Studio is also the development studio behind the critically acclaimed 2008 action sports game, PURE. PURE won numerous awards, including the Game Critics Awards: Best of E3 2008 for Best Racing Game, and was named among the top 10 video games of 2008 by Entertainment Weekly. Formerly Climax Racing, Black Rock Studio is a development studio of Disney Interactive Studios and is based in Brighton, England. About Disney Interactive Studios Disney Interactive Studios, part of Disney Interactive Media Group, is the interactive entertainment affiliate of The Walt Disney Company (NYSE:DIS). Disney Interactive Studios self publishes and distributes a broad portfolio of multi-platform video games, mobile games and interactive entertainment worldwide. The company also licenses properties and works directly with other interactive game publishers to bring products for all ages to market. Disney Interactive Studios is based in Glendale, California, and has internal development studios around the world. For more information, log on to http://www.disneyinteractivestudios.com. © Disney. Product names, release dates and features may be subject to change. Disney Interactive Studios Eric Wein, 818-553-4137 eric.wein@disney.com Ross Purnell, 818-553-5022 ross.n.purnell@disney.com Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.headline: Visa et NeuStar s`associent pour donner une nouvelle impulsion aux paiements mobiles et aux services financiers sécurisés au niveau mondial
entry.body: Une alliance stratégique permet aux opérateurs de réseaux mobiles, aux institutions financières et à Visa de collaborer afin d`accélérer la commercialisation de services financiers mobiles BARCELONE, Espagne--(Business Wire)-- Visa Inc. (NYSE: V), le plus grand réseau mondial1 de paiement électronique de détail, et NeuStar (NYSE: NSR), un prestataire de services d`interconnexion sécurisés auprès de nombreux grands opérateurs mondiaux de réseaux sans fil, ont annoncé aujourd`hui une alliance stratégique visant à accélérer l`adoption des services financiers mobiles à l`échelle mondiale. Leaders dans leur secteur respectif, Visa et NeuStar ont une histoire commune au cours de laquelle ils ont rendu possibles des transactions complexes et sécurisées. Ils ont également contribué à la sécurité et à l`interopérabilité qui ont permis l`essor du paiement électronique et des télécommunications mobiles, deux industries qui doivent aujourd`hui trouver de nouvelles façons de collaborer. L`alliance intègrera la fiabilité, l`échelle et la sécurité du réseau mondial de paiement de Visa à l`infrastructure de classe transporteur de NeuStar qui fournit des services d`interconnexion critiques aux opérateurs de réseau mondiaux et à leurs partenaires en facilitant la fourniture intégrée de services mobiles aux consommateurs dans le monde entier. « L`alliance Visa-NeuStar fournit à Visa un point unique de connexion aux opérateurs de réseaux mobiles du globe et soutient la stratégie internationale de Visa visant à l`extension de ses produits et services au secteur du mobile », a déclaré Elizabeth Buse, responsable Produit chez Visa Inc. « Cette initiative nous offre l`opportunité d`accélérer la fourniture de services financiers mobiles tant dans les économies émergentes que développées. Ces services comprennent les paiements mobiles, la recharge sans fil de comptes prépayés, le transfert monétaire, les services à valeur ajoutée tels que les alertes et les offres, ainsi que l`acceptation mobile de paiements électroniques. » NeuStar jouera le rôle d`intermédiaire neutre facilitant le transfert de données sécurisé et fiable entre les opérateurs mobiles et d`autres acteurs collaborant à la fourniture de services mobiles aux consommateurs. NeuStar ajoute de la valeur en fournissant un point de contact unique pour tous les services, simplifiant ainsi la tâche des opérateurs mobiles et de leurs partenaires pour connecter et offrir de nouveaux services à leurs abonnés. NeuStar exploite également le service PathFinder de la GSMA qui fournit un mécanisme de recherche d`adressage et de service commun et mondial aux services de communication classiques, qui peut être étendu aux services émergents comme le transfert monétaire par le réseau mobile. PathFinder fournit aussi un socle-clé de validation pour la collaboration entre les opérateurs et leurs partenaires commerciaux, notamment d`autres opérateurs et prestataires de services financiers comme Visa. « NeuStar, Visa et nos partenaires opérateurs sont des marques fiables, Visa dans le paiement, NeuStar dans l`échange de données en réseau et les opérateurs dans les communications mobiles », a déclaré Steve Edwards, le directeur général adjoint en charge des Services d`adressage convergés chez NeuStar. « Cette collaboration permet aux opérateurs de réseau, aux institutions financières, à Visa et aux consommateurs d`accéder rapidement au monde du paiement mobile et de bénéficier des formidables opportunités qui vont apparaître. Nous sommes impatients de rejoindre Visa, les institutions financières et les opérateurs de réseau mobile pour développer les meilleures pratiques et des applications destinées aux services financiers mobiles. » Avantages et applications L`initiative Visa-NeuStar permettra de proposer de très nombreux avantages aux acteurs du mobile et des services financiers à l`échelle mondiale en : * Ouvrant de nouveaux canaux permettant aux institutions financières clientes de Visa d`atteindre leurs clients là et au moment où ils sont prêts à utiliser des services financiers mobiles * Créant de nouveaux flux de revenus grâce à une nouvelle gamme de services financiers tels que les alertes et les offres de transactions mobiles * Ouvrant les services financiers mobiles aux consommateurs situés dans des régions où la pénétration des produits de paiement et des services financiers est faible. Ces services peuvent comprendre le télépaiement à distance pour des services comme le paiement de facture et la recharge de minutes sans fil et le transfert monétaire mobile * Raccourcissant le délai de commercialisation des services financiers mobiles en fournissant des infrastructures standardisées et évolutives avec les meilleures pratiques pour les applications monétaires mobiles. Par exemple, les opérateurs mobiles pourront désormais intégrer leurs données à des informations fournies par l`institution financière d`un client afin de proposer des offres plus personnalisées et ciblées qui seront envoyées sur le dispositif mobile d`un abonné par les services mobiles de Visa. Il serait ainsi potentiellement possible d`augmenter le taux de réponse des abonnés aux offres tout en augmentant la pertinence des messages. La collaboration autorisera également le transfert d`argent vers des comptes mobiles en passant par le réseau Visa. Par exemple, le réseau Visa pourrait envoyer des fonds vers le compte d`un utilisateur mobile en permettant au destinataire de faire usage des fonds déposés pour la recharge sans fil de minutes prépayées ou pour le paiement de facture de services sans fil. Le destinataire peut également accéder à ces fonds par une carte Visa prépayée ou par retrait à un DAB à proximité. L`intégration des technologies Visa et NeuStar peut également permettre aux opérateurs de fournir des données pertinentes concernant les capacités du combiné téléphonique. Visa serait alors en mesure de détecter la marque du téléphone, le modèle, la taille d`écran, le type de navigateur et les capacités multimédias pour adapter intelligemment le combiné téléphonique à l`usage qu`en a l`utilisateur. Nouveaux modèles stratégiques issus de la collaboration entre réseaux Avec l`alliance annoncée aujourd`hui au forum Mobile Money Summit 2009 de la GSMA, NeuStar et Visa consacrent des ressources pour soutenir le développement de programmes commercialement viables afin de gérer de nouveaux cas d`utilisation d`applications. L`initiative est également destinée à mettre en œuvre une gamme de services de paiement mobiles plus étendue en permettant à Visa, aux institutions financières et aux opérateurs de téléphonie mobile de collaborer plus étroitement pour fournir des transactions plus riches en informations, à même d`augmenter la personnalisation, la fonctionnalité et la sécurisation des paiements mobiles. À propos de NeuStar NeuStar (NYSE: NSR) fournit des services leader du marché et innovants autorisant la communication sécurisée entre réseaux, applications et entreprises autour du monde. Pour plus d`informations, visitez www.neustar.biz. À propos de Visa Inc. Visa (NYSE: V) exploite le plus important réseau de paiement électronique de vente au détail au monde, offrant des services de traitement et des plateformes de produit de paiement. Ceux-ci comprennent le crédit à la consommation, le débit, les paiements prépayés et commerciaux offerts sous les marques Visa, Visa Electron, Interlink et PLUS. Visa bénéficie d`un réseau d`acceptation inégalé dans le monde et Visa/PLUS est l`un des plus importants réseaux de DAB au monde, offrant l`accès aux espèces en monnaie locale dans plus de 170 pays. Pour plus d`informations, visitez www.corporate.visa.com. 1 Sur la base du volume de paiements, du volume total, du nombre de transactions et du nombre total de cartes en circulation. Pour plus d`informations réservées à la presse : Visa Inc. Elvira Swanson, +1 415-932-2564 globalmedia@visa.com ou NeuStar Marc Abshire, +1 571-434-5151 marc.abshire@neustar.biz Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.author: None
entry.headline: ExxonMobil Contributes $590,000 to Meeker School District
entry.body: Two Grants to Improve Math and Science Education Focus on New Elementary School MEEKER, Colo.--(Business Wire)-- The Meeker School District announced today that ExxonMobil has made two multiple-year grants to improve math and science education and teacher training. The combined grants provide $590,000 to support facilities expansion, staffing, equipment and professional training programs designed to deliver advanced math and science learning opportunities primarily for students at the new Meeker elementary school, currently under construction. A five-year $350,000 grant was awarded to the Meeker School District to provide support in three key areas: * Facilities. Build out and purchase equipment and materials for a state-of-the-art math and science laboratory in the new Meeker elementary school. * Staff. Provide assistance to fund the District`s first-ever Math and Science Coach-Coordinator who will serve as a school-wide resource. * Equipment. Provide an interactive whiteboard system for each elementary school classroom as well as for math and science classrooms in the District`s middle and high school. "The Meeker School District is honored to accept ExxonMobil`s contribution," Meeker Superintendent Dan Evig commented. "This funding will make the District`s new elementary school a model for math and science education in the region." A three-year $240,000 grant will provide funding to the Department of Mathematics and Computer Science at the Colorado School of Mines to develop a collaboration to improve K-5 mathematics and science in the Meeker School District. As part of the program, elementary school faculty will attend summer workshops at the Colorado School of Mines and receive online educational support and training throughout the academic year. The grant will also support infrastructure for an interactive link to allow Meeker teachers access to the Colorado School of Mines facilities. "ExxonMobil is pleased to make these grants to the Meeker School District and the Colorado School of Mines," noted James F. Branch, Piceance Project Executive, ExxonMobil Production Company. "We strongly believe in investing in the communities in which we operate and improving math and science education is a signature part of ExxonMobil`s community involvement program." Superintendent Dan Evig also stated that ExxonMobil has supported various initiatives to improve math and science education in the Meeker School District over the past three years. Meeker School District Jason Hightower, 970-878-9040 Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Visa en NeuStar gaan samenwerken om wereldwijd veilige mobiele betalingen en financiële diensten te stimuleren
entry.body: Strategisch samenwerkingsverband maakt samenwerking tussen exploitanten van mobiele netwerken, financiële instellingen en Visa mogelijk, met als gevolg snellere levering van mobiele financiële diensten BARCELONA, Spanje--(Business Wire)-- Visa Inc. (NYSE: V), het grootste netwerk voor elektronische retailbetalingen ter wereld1, en NeuStar (NYSE: NSR), een vertrouwd provider van interconnectiediensten voor tal van toonaangevende exploitanten van draadloze netwerken over de hele wereld, hebben vandaag bekendgemaakt dat zij een strategisch samenwerkingsverband aangaan, met als doel de wereldwijde invoering van mobiele financiële diensten te versnellen. Visa en NeuStar, beide marktleider in hun branche, hebben gemeen dat ze voorwaarden scheppen voor complexe, veiligheidsgevoelige transacties en de veiligheid en mondiale uitwisselbaarheid bieden die aan de basis staan van de groei van het elektronische betalingsverkeer en de mobiele telecommunicatie, twee bedrijfstakken die nu op nieuwe manieren moeten samenwerken. In dit samenwerkingsverband zullen de betrouwbaarheid, schaal en veiligheid van Visa`s wereldwijde betalingsnetwerk worden gecombineerd met NeuStar`s "carrier grade" infrastructuur die zorgt voor interconnectiediensten die van cruciaal belang zijn voor wereldwijd opererende netwerkexploitanten en hun partners en daarmee naadloze levering van mobiele diensten aan consumenten over de hele wereld mogelijk maakt. "Dankzij het samenwerkingsverband met NeuStar krijgt Visa direct toegang tot mobiele netwerken over de hele wereld, een belangrijke ondersteuning voor Visa`s wereldwijde strategie om zijn aanbod van producten en diensten uit te breiden naar het mobiele kanaal", aldus Elizabeth Buse, Head of Product bij Visa Inc. "Met dit initiatief kunnen we de levering van mobiele financiële diensten versnellen, zowel in opkomende als ontwikkelde economieën. Die diensten omvatten mobiele betalingen, het draadloos opwaarderen van prepaid rekeningen, geldoverboekingen, waardetoevoegende diensten, zoals aankondigingen en aanbiedingen, en mobiele acceptatie van elektronische betalingen." NeuStar fungeert als neutrale schakel die zorgt voor een veilige en betrouwbare gegevensoverdracht tussen exploitanten van mobiele netwerken en andere partijen die betrokken zijn bij de levering van mobiele diensten aan consumenten. NeuStar voegt waarde toe door één centraal contactpunt voor alle diensten te bieden, waardoor exploitanten van mobiele netwerken en hun partners veel gemakkelijker verbindingen tot stand kunnen brengen en hun abonnees nieuwe diensten kunnen aanbieden. NeuStar exploiteert tevens de PathFinder-dienst van GSMA, die zorgt voor een gemeenschappelijk wereldwijd systeem voor adressering en automatische ontdekking voor traditionele communicatiediensten en die uitbreidbaar is voor opkomende diensten, zoals mobiele overboekingen. PathFinder biedt tevens een belangrijke basis voor samenwerking tussen netwerkexploitanten en de door hen gekozen handelspartners, waaronder andere netwerkexploitanten en financiële dienstverleners, zoals Visa. "NeuStar, Visa en de met ons samenwerkende netwerkexploitanten vertegenwoordigen vertrouwde merken: Visa in het betalingsverkeer, NeuStar in de uitwisseling van netwerkgegevens, en netwerkexploitanten in de mobiele communicatie", aldus Steve Edwards, Senior Vice President Converged Addressing Services bij NeuStar. "Dankzij dit samenwerkingsverband kunnen netwerkexploitanten, financiële instellingen, Visa en consumenten snel overgaan op mobiel betalen en meeprofiteren van de opwindende mogelijkheden die in het verschiet liggen. We zien ernaar uit om samen met Visa, met financiële instellingen en met mobiele netwerkexploitanten te werken aan de beste praktijken en toepassingen voor mobiele financiële diensten." Voordelen en toepassingen Het Visa-NeuStar initiatief zal belanghebbenden in de mobiele en financiële dienstverlening overal ter wereld een groot aantal voordelen opleveren: * Financiële instellingen die klant zijn van Visa, krijgen nieuwe kanalen tot hun beschikking om hun klanten te bereiken waar en wanneer deze toe zijn aan mobiele financiële diensten. * Er worden nieuwe inkomstenstromen gecreëerd door het aanbod van een nieuw assortiment financiële diensten, zoals mobiele meldingen en aanbiedingen van transacties. * Mobiele financiële diensten kunnen worden geleverd aan consumenten in regio`s met een lage penetratie van betalingsproducten en financiële diensten; voorbeelden van zulke producten en diensten zijn mobiele betaling op afstand voor diensten zoals het betalen van rekeningen, het opwaarderen van beltegoeden en het overboeken van geld. * De marktintroductietijd voor mobiele financiële diensten wordt korter dankzij het aanbod van gestandaardiseerde en schaalbare infrastructuur en beste praktijken voor mobiele betalingstoepassingen. Exploitanten van mobiele netwerken kunnen nu bijvoorbeeld hun eigen gegevens koppelen aan informatie geleverd door de financiële instellingen van hun klanten, zodat via Visa`s mobiele diensten meer gepersonaliseerde en relevante aanbiedingen naar het mobiele apparaat van een abonnee kunnen worden gestuurd. Dit kan leiden tot meer gerichte reclame en tot een hogere respons van abonnees op aanbiedingen. Het samenwerkingsverband maakt tevens overboeking van geld naar mobiele rekeningen via het Visa-netwerk mogelijk. Het Visa-netwerk kan bijvoorbeeld geld sturen naar de rekening van een gebruiker van een mobiele telefoon, waarmee deze vervolgens zijn prepaid beltegoed kan opwaarderen of rekeningen voor draadloze diensten kan betalen. De begunstigde kan ook toegang tot dit geld krijgen via een prepaid kaart van Visa of door een geldopname bij een geldautomaat. De combinatie van technologieën van Visa en NeuStar zal netwerkexploitanten misschien ook de mogelijkheid bieden om te zorgen voor relevante informatie over de functies van het telefoontoestel. Visa zou dan merk, model, schermgrootte, browsertype en multimediafuncties van een toestel kunnen detecteren en op basis daarvan de gebruikerservaring voor dat toestel gericht kunnen aanpassen. Nieuwe bedrijfsmodellen door samenwerking van netwerken In het kader van het samenwerkingsverband, dat vandaag is bekendgemaakt op het jaarlijkse GSMA-congres over mobiel geld, bundelen NeuStar en Visa hun krachten voor de ontwikkeling van commercieel levensvatbare programma`s ter ondersteuning van nieuwe toepassingen. Het initiatief is tevens bedoeld om een steviger pakket mobiele betalingsdiensten mogelijk te maken, omdat het Visa, financiële instellingen en exploitanten van mobiele netwerken de mogelijkheid biedt nauwer samen te werken en te zorgen voor informatierijke transacties die mobiele betalingsdiensten persoonlijker, functioneler en veiliger kunnen maken. Over NeuStar NeuStar (NYSE: NSR) levert marktleidende en innovatieve diensten die veilige communicatie tussen netwerken, toepassingen en bedrijven over de hele wereld mogelijk maken. Ga voor meer informatie naar www.neustar.biz. Over Visa Inc. Visa (NYSE: V) exploiteert `s werelds grootste netwerk van elektronische betalingen voor de detailhandel. Visa zorgt voor de verwerking van betalingsopdrachten en levert platformen voor het betalen van producten. Dit omvat consumentenbetalingen d.m.v. creditcards en pinpassen, prepaid betalingen en commerciële betalingen, aangeboden onder de merknamen Visa, Visa Electron, Interlink en PLUS. Visa heeft een ongeëvenaard hoog acceptatieniveau in de hele wereld en Visa/PLUS is een van de grootste mondiale ATM-netwerken van de wereld, dat in meer dan 170 landen toegang biedt tot contant geld in de lokale munteenheid. Ga voor meer informatie naar www.corporate.visa.com. 1 Gebaseerd op het betalingsvolume, het totale volume, het aantal transacties en het totale aantal kaarten dat in omloop is. Voor meer informatie (alleen pers): Visa Inc. Elvira Swanson, +1 415-932-2564 globalmedia@visa.com of NeuStar Marc Abshire, +1 571-434-5151 marc.abshire@neustar.biz Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Namo Introduces UNETSHA, a Plug-in for Microsoft NAP
entry.body: SANTA CLARA, CA, Jun 23 (MARKET WIRE) -- SJ Namo, Inc., a leading developer and global supplier of software solutions for the world wide web, and UNET SYSTEM Co. Ltd., a leading developer in professional information security, have joined together to create UNETSHA, a product that provides high levels of information security under diverse variety conditions. UNETSHA is a plug-in for Network Access Protection in Microsoft Windows Server 2008. UNETSHA strengthens NAP's security health check capabilities and interoperability with third-party endpoint security solutions and enables it to work in a heterogeneous environment that includes Windows, Linux and Mac systems. UNETSHA provides information security tools and services for a highly secure, defect-free ubiquitous networking environment that caters to the needs of the customer. Supported Client OS Windows Vista, XP with Service Pack 3 Linux Fedora 6/Ubuntu 7.0 or later Apple Mac OS X Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) Support WMI is used to manage the status, configurations and operational aspects of hardware and software in Windows. Over 7,000 managed objects in WMI can be used as NAP policy objects for better security. Included ECs: 802.1X Supplicant and DHCP Client Linux and Mac OS X versions include NAP Agent with ECs for 802.1x-authenticated connections and DHCP-based IPv4 address configuration. Hierarchical Group Management With UNETSHA, the administrator can manage NAP polices based on the actual organizational structure of the enterprise. Policy Management based on User ID and Hierarchical Group The default NAP policy is enforced for all PCs in the same domain. UNETSHA supports login ID based policy enforcement for exceptional cases, making NAP policy enforcement more flexible. RQS Migration RQS is a Network Access Quarantine Control framework for Windows Server 2003 which provides additional protection capabilities for remote control such as dial-up and VPN connection. UNETSHA ensures that your RQS policy can be migrated to the NAP environment, either manually or automatically. Plug-ins for Diverse Client Health Check Programs To support additional PC health check capabilities that are not included in UNETSHA, UNETSHA allows plug-ins for diverse health check programs independent of their type (VBS, EXE, BAT, etc.). This feature is included in the RQS Package in order to strengthen NAP policy enforcement with a diverse variety of PC health check programs. SJ NAMO, Inc. 2005 De La Cruz Blvd. Suite 245 Santa Clara, CA 95050 USA Main Line. +1(408)-567-9005 FAX. 1(408)-567-9014 E-mail. Email Contact Copyright 2009, Market Wire, All rights reserved. -0-
